      • Command

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse(String command)
        Parses the user's input. Supports spaces, commas, semicolons, single quotes, and double quotes. Recognizes \" in double quotes as an escape sequence and \' in single quotes as an escape sequence. Are treated as literals outside their respective quotes. You do not need to use \\ to get \ in a quote.
        Parameters:
        command - Raw user input.

      • format

        public String format(String to)
        Takes the arguments and formats them according to to.
        For example:
         Command c = new Command("cmd");
 c.parse("cmd arga argb 'argc d'");
 System.out.println(c.format("%s %S, %s"));
        Will output: "arga ARGB, argc d"
        Parameters:
        to - String containing the format to use.
        Returns:
        Formatted version.

      • argCount

        public int argCount()
        Returns:
        The number of arguments.

      • getArg

        public String getArg(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - Index of argument.
        Returns:
        Argument at index i

      • getArgs

        public String[] getArgs()
        Returns:
        A String array of all the arguments.

      • getCmd

        public String getCmd()
        Returns:
        The command set when instantiated.
